title: Tai Do
text:
*I am still learning how to build my website using Quarto! Sorry for the inconvenience. *

Hello!
My name is Tai (he/him).
I am passionate about sense of belonging research in education and higher education contexts, and extremely motivated to support students from systematically marginalized and disenfranchised backgrounds (e.g., first-generation, low-income, students of color, and holding immigrant or refugee status).
I am a current PhD Candidate within the Psychological Foundations of Education Program in the Department of Educational Psychology at the University of Minnesota Twin Cities. 

I am a mixed- and multi-methods researcher, with knowledge at the intersections of social psychology, education, and educational and psychological measurement.
I am a 1.5 generation Vietnamese American immigrant from low-income background, and who is also the first in his family to attend college.
If you are interested in collaborating with me on any projects, and/or just talking, please definitely reach out!
---


Education
Spring, 2024 (expected) - University of Minnesota – Twin Cities: Doctor of Philosophy – Educational Psychology - Emphasis: Social Psychological and Developmental Processes
Fall, 2021 - University of Minnesota – Twin Cities: Master of Arts – Educational Psychology - Emphasis: Social Psychological and Developmental Processes; Thesis: Sense of Belonging Scale Development and Viability
Spring, 2014 - University of Minnesota – Twin Cities: Bachelor of Arts in Psychology; Bachelor of Arts in Sociology; Applied Psychology in Educational Settings Minor
